Describe unique values in a data frame

Source: R/describe_unique.R
describe_unique.Rd

Describe unique values in a data frame

Usage

describe_unique(
  df,
  ...,
  .rename_first = "value",
  .set_names = NULL,
  .names_to = "variable"
)

Arguments

df

data frame

...

unquoted data frame columns

.rename_first

default is "value"

.set_names

vector of names

.names_to

default is "variable"

Value

a data frame with unique values

Examples

x <- fuimus:::forager_data(200)

x
#> # A tibble: 200 × 5
#>    claim_id payer        ins_class balance dates           
#>    <chr>    <chr>        <chr>       <dbl> <list>          
#>  1 001      UnitedHealth Primary     111.  <tibble [1 × 5]>
#>  2 002      Anthem       Secondary   167.  <tibble [1 × 5]>
#>  3 003      Medicaid     Secondary   136.  <tibble [1 × 5]>
#>  4 004      Medicare     Secondary   211.  <tibble [1 × 5]>
#>  5 005      UnitedHealth Secondary    77.2 <tibble [1 × 5]>
#>  6 006      Humana       Primary     342.  <tibble [1 × 5]>
#>  7 007      Cigna        Secondary    35.2 <tibble [1 × 5]>
#>  8 008      Cigna        Primary     320.  <tibble [1 × 5]>
#>  9 009      Centene      Secondary   280.  <tibble [1 × 5]>
#> 10 010      Centene      Primary     128.  <tibble [1 × 5]>
#> # ℹ 190 more rows

describe_unique(x, claim_id, payer)
#> # A tibble: 208 × 3
#>    variable value     n
#>       <int> <chr> <int>
#>  1        1 001       1
#>  2        1 002       1
#>  3        1 003       1
#>  4        1 004       1
#>  5        1 005       1
#>  6        1 006       1
#>  7        1 007       1
#>  8        1 008       1
#>  9        1 009       1
#> 10        1 010       1
#> # ℹ 198 more rows
